text: Carlisle Sessions Floyd (June 11, 1926September 30, 2021) was an American opera composer. Many of his songs were based on his life living in the American South. His best known opera, Susannah (1955), is based on a story from the Biblical Apocrypha. He was born in Latta, South Carolina. Floyd died in Tallahassee, Florida on September 30, 2021, at the age of 95. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American composers Category:Writers from South Carolina
title: Carlisle Floyd
